arm_group.description: 208 women diagnosed with PCOS and giving birth after singleton pregnancies at Odense University Hospital during 2003-2011.
1040 women giving birth after singleton pregnancies at Odense University Hospital during 2003-2011, matched 1:5 to women with PCOS according to date-of-childbirth.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to investigate body composition in newborn children of women with
      PCOS and controls and to investigate adverse obstetric outcomes in pregnant women with PCOS.

clinical_study.brief_title: Obstetric Outcomes in Women With PCOS

detailed_description.textblock:
A prospective cohort study investigating 208 women with PCOS giving birth after singleton
      pregnancies at Odense Univesity Hospital during 2003-2011 and a date-of-childbirth matched
      control group of 1040 women. Anthropometric data from children is recorded as well as data
      on maternal parity, age, pre-gestational BMI, and adverse obstetric outcomes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosed with PCOS and giving birth during 2003-2011

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Multiple pregnancy

study_pop.textblock:
208 women diagnosed with PCOS at Department of Endocrinology and Metabolism and giving
        birth at Odense University Hospital during 2003-2011. Women with PCOS are matched 1:5 to a
        date-of-childbirth matched control group of 1040 pregnant women giving birth at Odense
        UNivesity Hospital.

facility.name: Department of Endocrinology, Odense University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Size at Birth in Newborn Children and Obstetric Outcomes in Women With PCOS

other_outcome.description: Registration of Apgar score 5 minutes after birth and admission to neonatal intensive care unit.

primary_outcome.description: Abdominal circumference, birth weight, birth length, and head circumference.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of gestational diabetes mellitus, pregnancy induced hypertension, or pre-eclampsia during pregnancy. Registration of gestational age at childbirth, medical induction of birth, caesarean section,instrumental delivery, anal sphincter rupture, and shoulder dystocia.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From beginning of pregnancy until the date of delivery (approximately 9 months)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
